Br own, Regional Director Federal Trade Commission - Southwest Region 1999 Bryan Street, Suite 2150 Dallas, Texas 75201 May 21, 2020 WARNING L ETTE R Via U.S. Mail and Email to: info@aznaturalmedicine.com Arizona Natural Medicine Physicians PLLC 2480 West Ray Road, Suite 1 Chan dler, Arizona 85224 Re: Unsubstantiated Claims for Coronavirus Prevention To Whom It May Concern: This is to advise you that FTC st aff has reviewed your website at https://www.aznaturalmedicine.com on May 14, 2020. We have determined that you are unlawfully advertising that ce rtain products prevent Corona virus Disease 2019 (COVID-19). Some examples of Coronavirus prevention claims on your website include the following representations: -On a page titled "CORONAVIRUS: IV NUTRI ENTS," "Arizona Natural Medicine® can offer you IV Nutrient therapies.... IV nutrient therapy ensures the vitamins and minerals you take for preven tion are actually able to do their job!... You can prime your immune system and protec t yourself and your family against the coronavirus with simple changes and interventions such as a Meyer's cocktail.... Contact Arizona Natural Medicine® to speak to a physician about infection prevention today." -On a page titled "CORONAVIRUS: HO W CAN YOU PROTECT YOURSELF?" you claim: "As a naturopathic physician I am an expert in preventative care. How can you protect yourself and your family against the Coronavirus, common cold and the flu? Let me guide you in ways to prepare your immune function and prevent viral infection," and "Fortunately, prevention is on your side! He re is a list of what YOU can do," which includes "Homeopathic medicine with expert guidance" and "IV Nutrient boost in office with trained practitioner."Arizona Natural Medicine Physicians PLLC May 20, 2020 Page 2 - On a page titled "CORONAVIRUS: SUPPLEMENTS, HERBS & HOMEOPATHIC REMEDIES," you claim: "Injectable support ma y also show great promise in supporting your immune system. At Arizona Natural Me dicine® we offer homeopathic injections such as Engystol which helps support im mune function and prevent infection." It is unlawful under the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 41 et seq. , to advertise that a product or service can prevent, treat, or cure human disease unless you possess competent and reliable scientific evidence, including, when appropriate, well-contro lled human clinical studies, substantiating that the claims are true at the time they are ma de. For COVID-19, no such study is currently known to exist for the products identified above. Thus, any coronavirus-related prevention claims regardi ng such products are not supported by competent and reliable scientific evidence. You must immediately cease making all such claims. You are also advised to review all other claims for your products or services and immediately cease making claims th at are not supported by competent and reliable scientific evidence. Within 48 hours, please send a message to A ssistant Director Jim Elliott via electronic mail at jelliott@ftc.gov describing the specific actions you have taken to address the FTC's concerns. If you have any ques tions regarding compliance with the FTC Act, please contact Reid Tepfer at rtepfer@ftc.gov. Very truly yours, Dama J. Brown Regional Director, Southwest Region Federal Trade Commission
